Desc: The Holman Feet-Elevated Alternating Single-Leg Hip Raise targets the glutes and hamstrings while also engaging the core. This exercise improves stability and strength in the lower body.
HowTo: 1. Lie on your back with your feet elevated on a bench. 2. Lift one leg while pushing through the heel of the other foot to raise your hips off the ground. 3. Hold for a moment, then lower your hips back down and switch legs.

Title: Holman Feet-Elevated Plank Pike Pull to Push-Up
Desc: The Holman Feet-Elevated Plank Pike Pull to Push-Up combines core stability with upper body strength. This dynamic movement challenges both the shoulders and the core.
HowTo: 1. Start in a plank position with your feet elevated. 2. Pike your hips up while pulling your body towards your feet, then lower back into a plank. 3. Perform a push-up, then return to the starting position.

Title: Holman Standing Heel Click
Desc: The Holman Standing Heel Click is a mobility exercise that enhances hip flexibility and coordination. It helps in improving balance and lower body movement.
HowTo: 1. Stand upright with feet shoulder-width apart. 2. Lift one foot off the ground and click your heels together while balancing on the other leg. 3. Alternate legs and repeat.

Title: Holman Straight Plank Right-Left Jack to Split Jack
Desc: The Holman Straight Plank Right-Left Jack to Split Jack is a high-intensity exercise that engages multiple muscle groups. It combines cardio with core stability for an effective workout.
HowTo: 1. Start in a straight plank position. 2. Jump your feet out to the sides (jack), then back in, followed by jumping into a split stance. 3. Return to the plank position and repeat.

Title: Holman Elbow Plank Jack to Ninja Knees
Desc: The Holman Elbow Plank Jack to Ninja Knees is a dynamic exercise that targets the core and improves cardiovascular fitness. It combines plank stability with explosive movements.
HowTo: 1. Start in an elbow plank position. 2. Jump your feet out to the sides (jack), then bring one knee towards your chest (ninja knee). 3. Alternate sides and repeat the sequence.

Title: Holman Right Side Elbow Plank with Left Leg Swing
Desc: The Holman Right Side Elbow Plank with Left Leg Swing is a core-strengthening exercise that targets the obliques and shoulders. It involves holding a plank position while swinging one leg out to the side, engaging the core for stability.
HowTo: 1. Start in a right side elbow plank position with your elbow directly under your shoulder. 2. Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels. 3. Swing your left leg out to the side while maintaining your plank position. 4. Return the leg to the starting position and repeat.

Title: Holman Left Side Elbow Plank with Right Leg Swing
Desc: The Holman Left Side Elbow Plank with Right Leg Swing is similar to its counterpart, focusing on core stability and shoulder strength. This exercise engages the obliques while maintaining a strong plank position.
HowTo: 1. Start in a left side elbow plank position with your elbow directly under your shoulder. 2. Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels. 3. Swing your right leg out to the side while maintaining your plank position. 4. Return the leg to the starting position and repeat.

Title: Holman Straight Plank with Alternating Diagonal Sit-Back
Desc: The Holman Straight Plank with Alternating Diagonal Sit-Back is a challenging core exercise that enhances stability and strength. It requires maintaining a plank while alternating leg movements to engage various muscle groups.
HowTo: 1. Begin in a straight plank position with your hands under your shoulders. 2. Engage your core and lift one leg while reaching the opposite arm forward. 3. Return to the plank position and alternate sides. 4. Maintain a straight line from head to heels throughout the movement.

Title: Holman Boat Press with Leg Extension
Desc: The Holman Boat Press with Leg Extension is a core-focused exercise that combines balance and strength. It targets the abdominals and hip flexors while improving overall stability.
HowTo: 1. Sit on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat. 2. Lean back slightly and lift your feet off the ground to form a 'V' shape with your body. 3. Extend your legs while pressing your arms forward. 4. Return to the starting position and repeat.

Title: Holman Shoulder Tap to Dirty Dog
Desc: The Holman Shoulder Tap to Dirty Dog is a dynamic exercise that targets the core, glutes, and shoulders. It combines stability and mobility, making it effective for overall strength.
HowTo: 1. Start in a high plank position with your hands under your shoulders. 2. Tap your left shoulder with your right hand while maintaining balance. 3. Transition into a 'Dirty Dog' position by lifting your right leg and bending your knee. 4. Return to plank and repeat on the other side.

Title: Holman Standing Russian Twist
Desc: The Holman Standing Russian Twist is a dynamic exercise that targets the core, particularly the obliques. It helps improve rotational strength and stability.
HowTo: 1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. 2. Hold a weight or medicine ball at chest level. 3. Rotate your torso to the right, bringing the weight beside your hip. 4. Return to the center and rotate to the left. 5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: Holman Hovering Plank with Shoulder Tap
Desc: The Holman Hovering Plank with Shoulder Tap is an effective core stability exercise that also engages the shoulders. It challenges your balance and coordination while strengthening the core.
HowTo: 1. Start in a plank position with your hands directly under your shoulders. 2. Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels. 3. Lift your right hand and tap your left shoulder. 4. Return your hand to the ground and repeat on the other side. 5. Continue alternating for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: Holman Elbow Plank to Stacked Plank Hip Drop
Desc: The Holman Elbow Plank to Stacked Plank Hip Drop is a challenging core exercise that enhances stability and strength. It involves transitioning between plank positions while engaging the hips.
HowTo: 1. Start in an elbow plank position. 2. Shift your weight to one side and drop your hip toward the floor. 3. Return to the plank position and repeat on the other side. 4. Continue alternating for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: Holman Elbow Plank to Walk-Up Pike
Desc: The Holman Elbow Plank to Walk-Up Pike is a full-body exercise that targets the core and shoulders. It combines plank movements with a pike position for added intensity.
HowTo: 1. Start in an elbow plank position. 2. Push up onto your hands one at a time to reach a high plank. 3. From the high plank, lift your hips up into a pike position. 4. Return to the elbow plank and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: Holman Hill Climber
Desc: The Holman Hill Climber is a high-intensity exercise that engages multiple muscle groups while providing a cardiovascular workout. It helps improve agility and endurance.
HowTo: 1. Start in a high plank position with your hands under your shoulders. 2. Drive your right knee toward your chest. 3. Quickly switch legs, bringing your left knee toward your chest. 4. Continue alternating legs at a fast pace for the desired duration.

Title: Holman Straight Plank Pike to Renegade Row
Desc: The Holman Straight Plank Pike to Renegade Row is a challenging core exercise that combines a plank position with a rowing motion. It engages multiple muscle groups for stability and strength.
HowTo: 1. Start in a plank position with your hands directly under your shoulders. 2. Engage your core and lift your hips towards the ceiling into a pike position. 3. Return to the plank position and perform a renegade row by pulling one elbow back towards your hip while stabilizing your body with the other arm. 4. Alternate sides and repeat.

Title: Holman Alternating Hip Drop to Push-Up
Desc: The Holman Alternating Hip Drop to Push-Up is a dynamic exercise that targets the chest and core while enhancing stability. It combines a push-up with a hip drop for added intensity.
HowTo: 1. Begin in a push-up position with your hands shoulder-width apart. 2. Lower your body into a push-up. 3. After pushing back up, drop one hip towards the floor while keeping the other arm stable. 4. Return to the push-up position and repeat on the other side.

Title: Holman Crab Kick
Desc: The Holman Crab Kick is a mobility exercise that enhances flexibility and coordination while engaging the core. It mimics a crawling motion to improve overall body control.
HowTo: 1. Start in a seated position with your feet flat on the ground and hands behind you. 2. Lift your hips off the ground into a crab position. 3. Extend one leg out while reaching the opposite arm across your body. 4. Return to the starting position and alternate sides.

Title: Holman Wounded Bear Crawl
Desc: The Holman Wounded Bear Crawl is a full-body exercise that builds strength and stability while engaging multiple muscle groups. It challenges your coordination and core control.
HowTo: 1. Start in a bear crawl position with your hands and knees on the ground. 2. Lift your knees slightly off the ground and crawl forward while keeping your back flat. 3. As you move, lift one arm and the opposite leg off the ground, mimicking a wounded animal's crawl. 4. Continue crawling forward, alternating sides.

Title: Holman Alternating Crab Reach
Desc: The Holman Alternating Crab Reach is a mobility exercise that enhances flexibility and coordination. It focuses on the core and shoulder stability while promoting full-body movement.
HowTo: 1. Begin in a crab position with your hands behind you and feet flat on the ground. 2. Lift your hips off the ground and reach one arm overhead while extending the opposite leg. 3. Return to the starting position and alternate sides. 4. Focus on maintaining stability through your core.

Title: Holman Hovering Panther Core Stabilizer
Desc: The Holman Hovering Panther Core Stabilizer is an exercise that focuses on core stability and strength. It engages multiple muscle groups to improve balance and coordination.
HowTo: 1. Start on all fours with your hands under your shoulders and knees under your hips. 2. Lift your knees off the ground slightly, keeping your back flat and core engaged. 3. Hold the position, maintaining stability without letting your hips sag or rise.

Title: Holman Burpee to Forward Lunge
Desc: The Holman Burpee to Forward Lunge is a dynamic exercise that combines strength and cardio. It works multiple muscle groups while elevating your heart rate.
HowTo: 1. Start standing, then drop into a squat and place your hands on the ground. 2. Jump your feet back into a plank position, perform a push-up, then jump your feet back towards your hands. 3. Stand up and step forward into a lunge, alternating legs with each repetition.

Title: Holman Seated Knee Pull-In Series
Desc: The Holman Seated Knee Pull-In Series is designed to strengthen the core and hip flexors. It is effective for improving overall abdominal strength and stability.
HowTo: 1. Sit on the floor with your legs extended in front of you. 2. Lean back slightly, keeping your back straight, and pull your knees towards your chest. 3. Extend your legs back out without touching the ground and repeat.

Title: Holman Elbow Plank Pike
Desc: The Holman Elbow Plank Pike is an exercise that targets the core and shoulders. It helps to build strength and stability in the abdominal region.
HowTo: 1. Start in an elbow plank position with your body in a straight line. 2. Engage your core and lift your hips towards the ceiling, forming a pike position. 3. Return to the plank position and repeat.

Title: Holman Elbow Plank Jack to Straight Plank Split Jack
Desc: The Holman Elbow Plank Jack to Straight Plank Split Jack is a challenging exercise that targets the core and shoulders. It combines plank variations to enhance stability and strength.
HowTo: 1. Begin in an elbow plank position with your feet together. 2. Jump your feet out to the sides and then back together, maintaining a strong core. 3. Transition to a straight-arm plank and perform a split jack by jumping your feet apart and back together.

Title: Holman Boat Pull-Over
Desc: The Holman Boat Pull-Over is an exercise that targets the upper back and shoulders. It helps improve strength and stability in the upper body.
HowTo: 1. Lie on your back with your arms extended above your head holding a weight. 2. Engage your core and pull the weight towards your chest while keeping your arms straight. 3. Slowly return to the starting position and repeat.

Title: Holman Squat Pulse to Plyometric Jump
Desc: The Holman Squat Pulse to Plyometric Jump combines strength and explosive power training. It targets the lower body and improves overall athletic performance.
HowTo: 1. Start in a squat position with your feet shoulder-width apart. 2. Perform three small pulses at the bottom of the squat. 3. Explode upwards into a jump, landing softly back into the squat position.

Title: Holman Hands Down Heel Click
Desc: The Holman Hands Down Heel Click is a dynamic mobility exercise that enhances flexibility and coordination. It engages multiple muscle groups for a full-body stretch.
HowTo: 1. Start in a standing position and lift one leg off the ground. 2. While balancing, click your heels together and switch legs. 3. Repeat the movement, focusing on maintaining balance.

Title: Holman Straight Plank to Kick-Up
Desc: The Holman Straight Plank to Kick-Up is an exercise that strengthens the core and improves stability. It challenges the abdominal muscles and enhances overall body control.
HowTo: 1. Start in a plank position with your arms straight and body in a straight line. 2. Engage your core and kick one leg up towards the ceiling. 3. Return to the plank position and repeat with the other leg.

Title: Holman Hands-Elevated Split Jack
Desc: The Holman Hands-Elevated Split Jack is a cardio exercise that increases heart rate while targeting the legs. It combines jumping jacks with a split stance for added intensity.
HowTo: 1. Stand with one foot elevated on a platform and the other on the ground. 2. Jump and switch your feet, landing with the opposite foot elevated. 3. Continue alternating feet while performing jumping jacks.

Title: Holman Feet-Elevated Plank Reach
Desc: The Holman Feet-Elevated Plank Reach is an advanced core exercise that targets the abdominals and shoulders while improving stability. It involves maintaining a plank position with feet elevated while reaching forward with one arm.
HowTo: 1. Start in a plank position with your feet elevated on a bench or platform. 2. Keep your body straight from head to heels. 3. Reach forward with one arm while maintaining balance. 4. Return to the plank position and repeat with the other arm.

Title: Holman Hand-Elevated Side Plank Semicircle
Desc: The Holman Hand-Elevated Side Plank Semicircle is a dynamic variation of the side plank that engages the obliques and shoulders. It combines stability and movement to enhance core strength.
HowTo: 1. Start in a side plank position with one hand elevated on a bench. 2. Keep your body in a straight line and engage your core. 3. Lower your hips towards the ground, then raise them back up while making a semicircle motion. 4. Repeat for the desired number of reps and switch sides.

Title: Holman Hands-Elevated Straight Plank Pike
Desc: The Holman Hands-Elevated Straight Plank Pike is a challenging exercise that targets the core and shoulders. It requires stability and strength to lift the hips while maintaining a plank position.
HowTo: 1. Begin in a plank position with your hands elevated on a bench. 2. Engage your core and lift your hips towards the ceiling, forming an inverted 'V' shape. 3. Hold for a moment, then return to the plank position. 4. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Title: Holman Alternating Rolling Elbow Plank
Desc: The Holman Alternating Rolling Elbow Plank is an effective exercise for building core strength and stability. It involves rolling from an elbow plank to a side plank, engaging multiple muscle groups.
HowTo: 1. Start in an elbow plank position. 2. Roll to one side into a side plank, stacking your feet. 3. Return to the elbow plank and repeat on the other side. 4. Continue alternating for the desired number of reps.

Title: Holman Elbow Plank Jack
Desc: The Holman Elbow Plank Jack is a core exercise that combines the plank position with a jumping motion to engage the entire body. It helps improve core stability and cardiovascular endurance.
HowTo: 1. Start in an elbow plank position with your body straight. 2. Jump your feet out wide, then jump them back together. 3. Keep your core engaged and maintain a straight line from head to heels. 4. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Title: Holman Squat Thrust to Alternating Knee-In
Desc: The Holman Squat Thrust to Alternating Knee-In is a dynamic exercise that combines a squat thrust with a knee drive. It engages multiple muscle groups and improves cardiovascular fitness.
HowTo: 1. Start in a standing position. 2. Lower into a squat and place your hands on the ground. 3. Jump your feet back into a plank position. 4. Bring one knee towards your chest, then return to plank. 5. Jump your feet back to your hands and return to standing. 6. Repeat, alternating knees.

Title: Holman Supine Double Pike
Desc: The Holman Supine Double Pike is an effective exercise for targeting the core and improving abdominal strength. It involves lifting the legs and upper body simultaneously.
HowTo: 1. Lie on your back with your arms extended above your head. 2. Lift your legs straight up towards the ceiling. 3. Simultaneously lift your upper body off the ground, reaching your hands towards your toes. 4. Lower back down and repeat.

Title: Holman Elbow Plank Alternating Pike
Desc: The Holman Elbow Plank Alternating Pike is a core-strengthening exercise that also engages the shoulders. It involves transitioning from a plank position to a pike position.
HowTo: 1. Start in an elbow plank position with your body in a straight line. 2. Lift your hips towards the ceiling, forming a pike position. 3. Return to the plank position. 4. Repeat, alternating the movement.

Title: Holman Seated Killer Abs
Desc: The Holman Seated Killer Abs is designed to target the abdominal muscles intensely. It focuses on both the upper and lower abs as well as the obliques.
HowTo: 1. Sit on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat. 2. Lean back slightly, engaging your core. 3. Lift your feet off the ground and hold them in the air. 4. Twist your torso to one side, then the other, while maintaining balance. 5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: Holman Side Plank Hip Drop
Desc: The Holman Side Plank Hip Drop is an excellent exercise for targeting the obliques and improving core stability. It involves lowering and raising the hips while in a side plank position.
HowTo: 1. Start in a side plank position, resting on one forearm with your body in a straight line. 2. Lower your hips towards the ground without touching it. 3. Raise your hips back to the starting position. 4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch sides.

Title: Holman Wide Hill Climber
Desc: The Holman Wide Hill Climber is a dynamic exercise that engages multiple muscle groups while improving cardiovascular fitness. It combines the benefits of climbing with a wide stance to enhance core stability and leg strength.
HowTo: 1. Start in a plank position with your hands under your shoulders. 2. Bring your right knee towards your chest while keeping your left leg extended. 3. Quickly switch legs, bringing your left knee towards your chest while extending your right leg. 4. Continue alternating legs at a fast pace.

Title: Holman Straight-Legged Bicycle
Desc: The Holman Straight-Legged Bicycle is an effective exercise for improving core strength and stability. It mimics the motion of cycling while engaging the abdominal muscles and hip flexors.
HowTo: 1. Lie on your back with your hands behind your head and legs extended. 2. Lift your legs off the ground and bend your knees at a 90-degree angle. 3. Extend your right leg while bringing your left elbow towards your right knee. 4. Switch sides, bringing your right elbow towards your left knee while extending your right leg. 5. Continue alternating sides in a controlled manner.

Title: Holman Stair Toe Tap
Desc: The Holman Stair Toe Tap is a simple yet effective exercise that targets the legs while improving coordination and cardiovascular fitness. It involves tapping your toes on a step or platform, engaging various leg muscles.
HowTo: 1. Stand in front of a step or platform with your feet hip-width apart. 2. Lift your right foot and tap your toes on the step. 3. Return your right foot to the ground and repeat with your left foot. 4. Continue alternating feet at a steady pace.

Title: Holman Elbow Plank Ninja
Desc: The Holman Elbow Plank Ninja is a challenging core exercise that builds strength and stability in the abdominal and shoulder muscles. It requires maintaining a plank position while incorporating dynamic movements.
HowTo: 1. Start in an elbow plank position with your elbows under your shoulders and body in a straight line. 2. Shift your weight to your right elbow and rotate your body to the left, extending your left arm towards the ceiling. 3. Return to the plank position and repeat on the other side. 4. Continue alternating sides while maintaining a stable core.

Title: Holman Traveling Stair Climb Push-Up
Desc: The Holman Traveling Stair Climb Push-Up is a compound exercise that combines push-ups with stair climbing, targeting multiple muscle groups. It enhances upper body strength while incorporating cardiovascular elements.
HowTo: 1. Start in a push-up position with your hands on a step or platform. 2. Perform a push-up, lowering your chest towards the step. 3. After the push-up, step your right foot up onto the step, followed by your left foot. 4. Step back down one foot at a time and repeat the push-up. 5. Continue this pattern, moving up and down the step.

Title: Holman Hands-Elevated Burpee
Desc: The Holman Hands-Elevated Burpee is a dynamic exercise that combines a squat, plank, and jump. It engages multiple muscle groups and improves cardiovascular fitness.
HowTo: 1. Start in a standing position. 2. Squat down and place your hands on an elevated surface. 3. Jump your feet back into a plank position. 4. Perform a push-up (optional). 5. Jump your feet back to your hands. 6. Jump up explosively to return to the standing position.

Title: Holman Straight Plank Donkey Kick
Desc: The Holman Straight Plank Donkey Kick targets the glutes and core while improving stability. It is an effective exercise for building strength in the posterior chain.
HowTo: 1. Start in a plank position with your hands under your shoulders. 2. Keeping your knee bent, lift one leg towards the ceiling while engaging your core. 3. Lower the leg back to the starting position. 4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions before switching legs.

Title: Holman Feet-Elevated Straight Plank Pike Pull
Desc: The Holman Feet-Elevated Straight Plank Pike Pull is a challenging core exercise that also engages the shoulders and legs. It enhances overall body strength and stability.
HowTo: 1. Start in a plank position with your feet elevated on a surface. 2. Engage your core and lift your hips towards the ceiling, forming a pike position. 3. Return to the plank position. 4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: Holman Towel Burpee
Desc: The Holman Towel Burpee is a high-intensity exercise that combines strength and cardio. It is great for burning calories and improving overall fitness.
HowTo: 1. Start in a standing position holding a towel. 2. Squat down and place the towel on the ground. 3. Jump your feet back into a plank position. 4. Perform a push-up (optional). 5. Jump your feet back to your hands, grabbing the towel. 6. Jump up explosively while holding the towel.

Title: Holman Elbow Plank to Alternating Side Plank Crunch
Desc: The Holman Elbow Plank to Alternating Side Plank Crunch is an excellent exercise for targeting the core and improving stability. It engages the obliques and helps build strength in the shoulders.
HowTo: 1. Start in an elbow plank position. 2. Rotate to one side into a side plank, lifting the top arm. 3. Bring the top knee towards your elbow in a crunch motion. 4. Return to the elbow plank and repeat on the other side.

Title: Holman Straight-Legged Hip Raise
Desc: The Holman Straight-Legged Hip Raise primarily targets the glutes and hamstrings while engaging the core. It is an effective exercise for building strength in the posterior chain.
HowTo: 1. Lie on your back with your legs straight and arms at your sides. 2. Lift your hips off the ground by squeezing your glutes, keeping your legs straight. 3. Hold at the top for a moment, then lower back down.

Title: Holman Feet-Elevated Hill Climber
Desc: The Holman Feet-Elevated Hill Climber is a dynamic exercise that elevates the heart rate while engaging multiple muscle groups. It combines cardio with strength training for an effective workout.
HowTo: 1. Start in a high plank position with your feet elevated on a surface. 2. Drive one knee towards your chest, then quickly switch legs in a running motion. 3. Continue alternating legs at a fast pace.

Title: Holman Ninja Knee Hill Climber
Desc: The Holman Ninja Knee Hill Climber is a high-intensity exercise that targets the core and lower body while improving cardiovascular fitness. It is great for building endurance and strength.
HowTo: 1. Begin in a high plank position with your hands under your shoulders. 2. Quickly bring one knee towards your chest, then switch to the other knee in a rapid motion. 3. Keep your core engaged and maintain a steady pace.

Title: Holman Feet-Elevated Shoulder Tap
Desc: The Holman Feet-Elevated Shoulder Tap is an excellent exercise for building shoulder stability and core strength. It challenges balance and coordination while engaging the upper body.
HowTo: 1. Start in a high plank position with your feet elevated. 2. Tap your left shoulder with your right hand while keeping your hips stable. 3. Alternate sides, tapping each shoulder without rotating your body.

Title: Holman Feet-Elevated Hip Raise
Desc: The Holman Feet-Elevated Hip Raise is a powerful exercise for strengthening the glutes and hamstrings while targeting the core. It enhances posterior chain development and stability.
HowTo: 1. Lie on your back with your feet elevated on a surface and knees bent. 2. Push through your heels to lift your hips towards the ceiling, squeezing your glutes. 3. Hold for a moment at the top, then lower back down.

Title: Holman Left Hand Right Foot Crab Reach
Desc: The Holman Left Hand Right Foot Crab Reach is a dynamic mobility exercise that engages multiple muscle groups while improving flexibility. It focuses on coordination and stability through a unique movement pattern.
HowTo: 1. Start in a crab position with your hands and feet on the ground, hips lifted. 2. Reach your left hand towards your right foot while maintaining balance, then return to the starting position. 3. Alternate sides.

Title: Holman Alternating Crab Flip to Froggy Push-Up to Kicks
Desc: The Holman Alternating Crab Flip to Froggy Push-Up to Kicks is a complex mobility exercise that enhances coordination and strength. It combines multiple movements to engage the entire body.
HowTo: 1. Begin in a crab position. 2. Flip your body to one side, transitioning into a froggy push-up position. 3. Perform a push-up, then kick one leg out to the side. 4. Return to the starting position and repeat on the other side.

Title: Holman Right Hand Left Foot Sleeping Crab
Desc: The Holman Right Hand Left Foot Sleeping Crab is a mobility exercise that promotes flexibility and coordination. It targets the core and limbs through a unique reach and balance challenge.
HowTo: 1. Start in a crab position with your hips elevated. 2. Reach your right hand towards your left foot while keeping your hips stable. 3. Return to the starting position and alternate sides.

Title: Holman Left Hand Right Foot Sleeping Crab
Desc: The Holman Left Hand Right Foot Sleeping Crab is a dynamic exercise that enhances mobility and stability. It engages the core and improves overall body coordination.
HowTo: 1. Begin in a crab position with your hips lifted. 2. Reach your left hand towards your right foot while maintaining balance. 3. Return to the starting position and switch sides.

Title: Holman Straight Plank with Alternating Leg Kick-Under
Desc: The Holman Straight Plank with Alternating Leg Kick-Under is a challenging mobility exercise that targets the core and improves stability. It combines a plank position with dynamic leg movements.
HowTo: 1. Start in a straight plank position with your body in a straight line. 2. Lift one leg and kick it under your body while rotating your hips slightly. 3. Return to the plank position and alternate legs.

Title: Holman Right Hip Drop Push-Up
Desc: The Holman Right Hip Drop Push-Up is a variation of the traditional push-up that emphasizes the chest and triceps while engaging the core. It incorporates a hip drop to challenge stability and strength.
HowTo: 1. Start in a push-up position with your hands shoulder-width apart. 2. Lower your body towards the ground while keeping your elbows close to your sides. 3. As you push back up, drop your right hip towards the ground. 4. Return to the starting position and repeat.

Title: Holman Right Side Diagonal Burpee
Desc: The Holman Right Side Diagonal Burpee is a dynamic exercise that combines a squat, push-up, and jump, targeting multiple muscle groups. It is great for improving cardiovascular fitness and overall body strength.
HowTo: 1. Start standing with your feet shoulder-width apart. 2. Drop into a squat and place your hands on the ground. 3. Jump your feet back into a push-up position. 4. Perform a push-up, then jump your feet back towards your hands. 5. Jump up explosively, reaching your arms overhead, and land back in the starting position.

Title: Holman Left Hip Drop Push-Up
Desc: The Holman Left Hip Drop Push-Up is similar to the right version, focusing on upper body strength with an added challenge to core stability. This exercise helps build strength in the chest and arms while engaging the core.
HowTo: 1. Start in a push-up position with your hands shoulder-width apart. 2. Lower your body towards the ground while keeping your elbows close to your sides. 3. As you push back up, drop your left hip towards the ground. 4. Return to the starting position and repeat.

Title: Holman Right Leg 7-Up Crunch
Desc: The Holman Right Leg 7-Up Crunch is an abdominal exercise that targets the core muscles, particularly the rectus abdominis and obliques. It helps improve core strength and stability.
HowTo: 1. Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. 2. Lift your right leg up towards the ceiling while keeping your left foot on the ground. 3. Crunch your upper body towards your right knee, engaging your core. 4. Lower back down and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: Holman Left Leg 7-Up Crunch
Desc: The Holman Left Leg 7-Up Crunch is a variation of the crunch that focuses on the abdominal muscles while engaging the core. This exercise is effective for building core strength and endurance.
HowTo: 1. Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. 2. Lift your left leg up towards the ceiling while keeping your right foot on the ground. 3. Crunch your upper body towards your left knee, engaging your core. 4. Lower back down and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: Holman Straight Plank Jack
Desc: The Holman Straight Plank Jack is an effective core exercise that engages the abdominal muscles while also providing a cardio component. It helps improve stability and strength in the core.
HowTo: 1. Start in a plank position with your hands directly under your shoulders. 2. Jump your feet out wide and then back together while maintaining a strong plank position. 3. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: Holman Feet-Elevated Couch Hill Climber
Desc: The Holman Feet-Elevated Couch Hill Climber is a dynamic exercise that targets multiple muscle groups while elevating the heart rate. It combines strength and cardio for a full-body workout.
HowTo: 1. Place your feet on an elevated surface like a couch. 2. Start in a plank position with your hands on the ground. 3. Quickly drive one knee towards your chest, then switch legs in a running motion. 4. Continue alternating legs for the desired duration.

Title: Holman Feet-Elevated Right Side Plank
Desc: The Holman Feet-Elevated Right Side Plank is a variation of the side plank that focuses on strengthening the oblique muscles. It enhances core stability and balance.
HowTo: 1. Lie on your right side with your feet elevated on a bench or couch. 2. Prop yourself up on your right elbow, keeping your body in a straight line. 3. Hold the position for the desired time, engaging your core.

Title: Holman Alternating Up-Down Plank to Push-Up
Desc: The Holman Alternating Up-Down Plank to Push-Up is a compound exercise that targets the chest and core while improving upper body strength. It combines the plank and push-up movements for a challenging workout.
HowTo: 1. Start in a plank position on your hands. 2. Lower your body into a push-up, then return to the plank. 3. Alternate between lowering to your elbows and pushing back up to your hands. 4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: Holman Straight Plank Pike
Desc: The Holman Straight Plank Pike is an excellent exercise for targeting the core and improving overall body control. It helps build strength in the abdominal muscles while also engaging the shoulders.
HowTo: 1. Start in a plank position with your hands under your shoulders. 2. Engage your core and lift your hips towards the ceiling, forming a pike position. 3. Hold for a moment, then return to the plank position. 4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: Holman Ninja Knee Straight Plank
Desc: The Holman Ninja Knee Straight Plank is an isometric exercise that targets the core muscles. It helps improve stability and strength in the abdominal region.
HowTo: 1. Start in a plank position with your body in a straight line. 2. Bring one knee towards your chest while maintaining the plank position. 3. Return to the starting position and repeat on the other side.

Title: Holman Reverse Crunch to Hip Raise
Desc: The Holman Reverse Crunch to Hip Raise is a compound exercise that engages the core and hip muscles. It helps in building strength and stability in the lower abdominal area.
HowTo: 1. Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. 2. Lift your legs towards your chest while curling your hips off the ground. 3. Slowly lower back to the starting position and repeat.

Title: Holman Straight Plank Quick Reach
Desc: The Holman Straight Plank Quick Reach is an effective core stabilization exercise. It enhances balance and engages multiple muscle groups in the core.
HowTo: 1. Begin in a straight plank position on your forearms and toes. 2. Reach one arm forward while keeping your body stable. 3. Return to the plank position and alternate arms.

Title: Holman Alternating Diagonal Straight Plank
Desc: The Holman Alternating Diagonal Straight Plank is a dynamic exercise that challenges your core stability. It works the abdominal muscles while also engaging the shoulders.
HowTo: 1. Start in a straight plank position on your hands. 2. Reach one arm diagonally forward while stabilizing your body. 3. Return to the plank and switch to the other arm.

Title: Holman Feet-Elevated Left Side Plank
Desc: The Holman Feet-Elevated Left Side Plank is an advanced variation of the side plank that targets the obliques and shoulders. It enhances core strength and stability.
HowTo: 1. Lie on your left side with your feet elevated on a bench or platform. 2. Prop yourself up on your left elbow, lifting your hips off the ground. 3. Hold the position while engaging your core.

Title: Holman Right Hand Left Foot Crab Reach
Desc: The Holman Right Hand Left Foot Crab Reach is a dynamic mobility exercise that improves flexibility and coordination. It engages multiple muscle groups while promoting stability and balance.
HowTo: 1. Start in a crab position with your hands and feet on the ground. 2. Reach your right hand towards your left foot while lifting your hips. 3. Return to the starting position and repeat on the other side.

Title: Holman Low-Impact Crab Kick
Desc: The Holman Low-Impact Crab Kick is a low-impact exercise that enhances cardiovascular endurance while engaging the entire body. It is suitable for those looking to improve their fitness without high-impact movements.
HowTo: 1. Begin in a crab position. 2. Alternate kicking your legs out in front of you while maintaining the crab position. 3. Keep your hips elevated and core engaged throughout the exercise.

Title: Holman Alternating Crab Flip to Froggy Push-Up
Desc: The Holman Alternating Crab Flip to Froggy Push-Up is a challenging exercise that builds strength and muscle in the upper body and core. It combines dynamic movements to enhance overall fitness.
HowTo: 1. Start in a crab position. 2. Flip your body to one side, transitioning into a froggy push-up position. 3. Perform a push-up, then return to the crab position and repeat on the other side.

Title: Holman High-Impact Crab Kick
Desc: The Holman High-Impact Crab Kick is a high-energy exercise that boosts cardiovascular fitness while engaging multiple muscle groups. It is ideal for those looking for a more intense workout.
HowTo: 1. Start in a crab position. 2. Quickly alternate kicking your legs out in front of you while keeping your hips elevated. 3. Maintain a fast pace to increase heart rate.

Title: Holman Single-Leg Right Pike
Desc: The Holman Single-Leg Right Pike is a mobility exercise that focuses on flexibility and balance in the legs and core. It helps improve stability while engaging the lower body.
HowTo: 1. Stand on your right leg and lift your left leg behind you. 2. Bend at the hips to reach towards the ground, keeping your back straight. 3. Return to standing and repeat on the other leg.

Title: Holman Single-Leg Left Pike
Desc: The Holman Single-Leg Left Pike is a mobility exercise that focuses on improving flexibility and balance in the legs. It engages the core while stretching the hamstrings and glutes.
HowTo: 1. Start in a standing position. 2. Lift your left leg straight in front of you. 3. Bend at the hips to reach towards your toes while keeping your back straight. 4. Hold for a moment, then return to standing.

Title: Holman Shoulder Tap to Hand Tap
Desc: The Holman Shoulder Tap to Hand Tap is a strength exercise that targets the shoulders and core stability. It involves alternating taps to engage the upper body while maintaining balance.
HowTo: 1. Start in a plank position with your hands under your shoulders. 2. Tap your left shoulder with your right hand while keeping your hips stable. 3. Return to plank and repeat with the opposite hand. 4. Continue alternating for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: Holman Towel Reverse Plank Jack
Desc: The Holman Towel Reverse Plank Jack is a dynamic cardio exercise that engages the entire body. It combines a plank position with jumping movements to elevate heart rate.
HowTo: 1. Start in a reverse plank position with your feet together and hands behind you. 2. Jump your feet out wide and then back together while maintaining the plank. 3. Repeat the jumping motion for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: Holman Side-to-Side Twist
Desc: The Holman Side-to-Side Twist is a mobility exercise that enhances spinal flexibility and engages the core. It helps in improving rotational strength and stability.
HowTo: 1. Sit on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat. 2. Lean back slightly and clasp your hands together. 3. Rotate your torso to the right, then to the left, while keeping your core engaged. 4. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: Holman Crab Kick with Hop
Desc: The Holman Crab Kick with Hop is a strength exercise that targets the core and lower body while improving coordination. It combines a crab position with a dynamic kicking motion.
HowTo: 1. Start in a crab position with your hands and feet on the ground, hips lifted. 2. Kick your right leg up while hopping on your left foot. 3. Return to the starting position and repeat on the opposite side. 4. Continue alternating for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: Holman Crab Reach to Crab Kick
Desc: The Holman Crab Reach to Crab Kick is a dynamic mobility exercise that improves flexibility and coordination. It involves reaching and kicking while maintaining a crab position.
HowTo: 1. Start in a crab position with your hands and feet on the ground, hips lifted. 2. Reach one arm up towards the ceiling while kicking the opposite leg out straight. 3. Return to the starting position and repeat on the other side.

Title: Holman Wide Squat Side-to-Side Obliques
Desc: The Holman Wide Squat Side-to-Side Obliques is an exercise that targets the lower body and engages the core. It involves a wide squat motion combined with lateral movement to activate the oblique muscles.
HowTo: 1. Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart. 2. Lower into a squat while shifting your weight to one side, then return to the center and shift to the other side. 3. Repeat the side-to-side motion while maintaining the squat position.

Title: Holman Side Plank Crunch
Desc: The Holman Side Plank Crunch is a core exercise that targets the obliques and rectus abdominis. It combines a side plank position with a crunching motion to engage the core muscles.
HowTo: 1. Start in a side plank position with your elbow directly under your shoulder. 2. Bring your top knee towards your chest while crunching your side, then return to the starting position. 3. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions before switching sides.

Title: Total Fitness Ab Tuck
Desc: The hollow-body knee tuck is a bodyweight abdominal exercise performed on the floor. It is similar to both the hollow-body hold and the knee tuck or reverse crunch, combining elements of both. It primarily targets the muscles of the rectus abdominis, or six-pack muscles. It can be performed for reps or time, either as part of an ab-focused workout or as a component of a circuit workout.
HowTo: 1. Lie on your back with your arms extended overhead and legs straight. 2. Engage your core and lift your legs and shoulders off the ground, tucking your knees towards your chest. 3. Hold for a moment, then lower back to the starting position.

Title: Active hang from bar
Desc: The active hang from bar is a static exercise that involves isometrically squeezing the shoulders into the sockets and activating the muscles of the upper back and core. It can be used to improve pull-up form or to do more pull-ups, but also has postural and shoulder health benefits.
HowTo: 1. Grip a pull-up bar with your hands shoulder-width apart. 2. Hang with your arms fully extended, engaging your shoulders by squeezing them into their sockets. 3. Hold this position for the desired duration, focusing on maintaining tension in your shoulders and core.

Title: Cat-cow
Desc: Cat-cow is a traditional yoga pose that is also popular in fitness and strength training. It targets spinal mobility and control of the vertebral column. It can be performed for time or reps as part of a dynamic warm-up or as a mobility or restorative exercise anytime. It can also work as part of a yoga or bodyweight sequence with other poses.
HowTo: Start on all fours with your hands under your shoulders and knees under your hips. Inhale as you arch your back and look up (cow position), then exhale as you round your back and tuck your chin (cat position).

Title: Crab walk
Desc: The crab walk is a full-body exercise that has been popular in schools and gym classes for decades. It's a full-body coordination challenge that also burns serious calories, making it an excellent inclusion in a full-body warm-up or bodyweight circuit workout.
HowTo: Sit on the ground with your knees bent and feet flat. Place your hands behind you with fingers pointing towards your feet, lift your hips off the ground, and walk forward using your hands and feet.

Title: Lunge with overhead reach
Desc: The lunge with overhead reach is a full-body bodyweight movement targeting the quads and shoulders. It has both strength and mobility benefits and can be performed one leg at a time or alternating for time or for reps.
HowTo: Stand tall, step forward with one leg into a lunge position, and as you lower your body, reach your arms overhead. Push through the front heel to return to standing and switch legs.

Title: Hang from bar
Desc: The hang from bar is a static exercise that involves hanging from a bar by two hands. It can either be an "active hang," where you pack the shoulders and activate the muscles of the upper back, or a "passive hang," where you let the shoulders unpack and let the muscles of the upper body stretch. A passive hang may not be appropriate for all people depending on their shoulder health, but many coaches believe hanging can be healthy for the shoulders when done properly.
HowTo: Grip a pull-up bar with both hands shoulder-width apart, hang with your arms fully extended, and engage your shoulders by pulling them down away from your ears for an active hang, or relax for a passive hang.

Title: Total Fitness Hollow Hold
Desc: The hollow-body hold is an isometric exercise that increases strength and stability in the core muscles. It is common in gymnastics training, CrossFit training, and as a core tension and bracing drill for lifters and athletes of all types. It is performed for time and can be performed as an activation drill prior to lifting, as part of a circuit, or as equipment-free core training anytime.
HowTo: Lie on your back, lift your legs and shoulders off the ground while keeping your lower back pressed into the floor, and hold this position with your arms extended overhead or by your sides.

Title: Total Fitness Side Plank
Desc: The side plank is a popular isometric abdominal exercise focusing on the oblique muscles, as well as the transversus abdominis or deep core muscles. It is sometimes paired with the curl up and bird dog as the McGill big three for core strength and stability. It is performed for time and can work in a warm-up or in the core-focused portion of any workout.
HowTo: 1. Lie on your side with your legs straight and stacked. 2. Prop yourself up on one elbow, lift your hips off the ground, and hold the position for time.

Title: Side plank pulse
Desc: The side plank pulse is a dynamic version of the side plank exercise focusing on the oblique muscles, as well as the transversus abdominis or deep core muscles. It can be performed for time or reps and can work in a warm-up or in the core-focused portion of any workout.
HowTo: 1. Start in a side plank position. 2. Lower your hips slightly and then pulse them up and down while maintaining the plank position.

Title: Total Fitness Spider Crawl (Unweighted)
Desc: The spider crawl is a bodyweight exercise that involves crawling on the floor with the knees outside of the elbows. It is different from a leopard crawl in that the hips are higher, and it's different from a bear crawl because the knees are wider. It can be done as a full-body warm-up, in short bursts for power or circuit training, or for longer durations as cardiovascular conditioning.
HowTo: 1. Start in a crawling position with your hands under your shoulders and knees off the ground. 2. Move forward by bringing one hand and the opposite knee forward, keeping your hips high.

Title: Total Fitness V-Up
Desc: The V-up is a bodyweight movement that targets the muscles of the abs, the rectus abdominis or "six-pack" muscles in particular. It is similar to a suitcase crunch, but the lower back lifts off the ground at the top of each rep. It can be performed for time or reps in the ab-focused portion of any workout.
HowTo: 1. Lie on your back with your arms extended overhead and legs straight. 2. Simultaneously lift your upper body and legs to form a 'V' shape, then lower back down.

Title: MetaBurn Alternating Knee-to-Elbow Mountain Climber
Desc: The MetaBurn Alternating Knee-to-Elbow Mountain Climber is a high-intensity exercise that engages multiple muscle groups while improving cardiovascular endurance.
HowTo: 1. Start in a plank position with your hands under your shoulders. 2. Drive one knee towards your elbow, then switch legs in a quick, alternating motion.

Title: Alternating sit-through with crunch-
Desc: The alternating sit-through with crunch is a full-body movement that starts in a bear crawl position and ends with a leg kicked out to the side. In between reps, you perform a crunch. It is commonly performed for reps or time in bodyweight circuits and animal-style flows, but can also work on its own or as part of a dynamic warm-up or mobility sequence.
HowTo: 1. Start in a bear crawl position with hands under shoulders and knees under hips. 2. Shift your weight to one side and extend the opposite leg out to the side while performing a crunch. 3. Return to the starting position and repeat on the other side.

Title: MetaBurn Alternating Toe-Touch
Desc: The MetaBurn Alternating Toe-Touch is a dynamic stretching exercise that targets the hamstrings and core. It involves alternating between reaching for your toes while standing.
HowTo: 1. Stand with feet hip-width apart. 2. Bend at the waist and reach for your right toes, keeping your left leg straight. 3. Return to standing and repeat on the left side.

Title: MetaBurn Janda Sit-Up
Desc: The MetaBurn Janda Sit-Up is a variation of the traditional sit-up that emphasizes the use of the hip flexors and abdominal muscles. It is performed with the feet elevated.
HowTo: 1. Lie on your back with your feet elevated on a bench or surface. 2. Engage your core and lift your torso towards your knees. 3. Lower back down with control and repeat.

Title: MetaBurn Oblique Roll Crunch
Desc: The MetaBurn Oblique Roll Crunch is an exercise that targets the obliques and core. It involves a rolling motion combined with a crunch.
HowTo: 1. Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. 2. Roll to one side while bringing your elbow towards your knee. 3. Return to the starting position and repeat on the other side.

Title: MetaBurn Plank Jack
Desc: The MetaBurn Plank Jack is a cardio exercise that combines a plank position with a jumping jack motion. It engages the core while providing a cardiovascular workout.
HowTo: 1. Start in a plank position with your hands under your shoulders. 2. Jump your feet out wide and then back together, keeping your core tight. 3. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Title: MetaBurn Plank To Alternating Side Plank
Desc: The MetaBurn Plank To Alternating Side Plank is an effective core exercise that engages multiple muscle groups. It helps improve stability and strength in the abdominal region.
HowTo: 1. Start in a plank position with your forearms on the ground. 2. Rotate your body to the side, lifting one arm towards the ceiling to enter a side plank. 3. Return to the starting plank position and repeat on the other side.

Title: MetaBurn Plank Up-Down
Desc: The MetaBurn Plank Up-Down targets the core and shoulders while enhancing stability. It is a dynamic exercise that challenges your balance and strength.
HowTo: 1. Begin in a plank position on your forearms. 2. Push up onto your hands one at a time, transitioning to a high plank. 3. Lower back down to your forearms one arm at a time and repeat.

Title: MetaBurn Plank Wiper
Desc: The MetaBurn Plank Wiper is a challenging core exercise that also engages the hip flexors. It enhances rotational strength and stability.
HowTo: 1. Start in a plank position with your forearms on the ground. 2. Rotate your hips to one side, bringing your knees towards the floor, then return to the center. 3. Repeat on the other side.

Title: MetaBurn Plank With Alternating Toe-Touch
Desc: The MetaBurn Plank With Alternating Toe-Touch is a core exercise that improves balance and coordination. It targets the abdominal muscles while engaging the shoulders.
HowTo: 1. Begin in a plank position with your hands directly under your shoulders. 2. Lift one hand to touch the opposite toe while maintaining balance. 3. Return to plank and repeat with the other hand.

Title: MetaBurn Plyo Push-Up
Desc: The MetaBurn Plyo Push-Up is an explosive exercise that builds upper body strength and power. It enhances muscle engagement and cardiovascular fitness.
HowTo: 1. Start in a push-up position with your hands shoulder-width apart. 2. Lower your body to the ground, then push up explosively so your hands leave the floor. 3. Land softly and go directly into the next repetition.

Title: MetaBurn Psycho Crunch
Desc: The MetaBurn Psycho Crunch is an abdominal exercise that targets the core muscles. It helps in building strength and stability in the midsection.
HowTo: 1. Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. 2. Place your hands behind your head, and lift your shoulders off the ground while engaging your core. 3. Crunch up towards your knees, then lower back down without touching the ground.

Title: MetaBurn Scapular Retraction Plank
Desc: The MetaBurn Scapular Retraction Plank is an exercise that strengthens the upper back and shoulders. It focuses on improving posture and stability.
HowTo: 1. Start in a plank position with your arms straight and hands under your shoulders. 2. Squeeze your shoulder blades together, retracting them while keeping your body straight. 3. Hold the position for a few seconds, then relax and repeat.

Title: MetaBurn Scapular Retraction Plank Hold
Desc: The MetaBurn Scapular Retraction Plank Hold enhances shoulder stability and strength. It is effective for improving upper body posture.
HowTo: 1. Begin in a plank position with your arms straight. 2. Focus on pulling your shoulder blades together and hold this position. 3. Maintain a straight line from head to heels while holding for a set duration.

Title: MetaBurn Scorpion
Desc: The MetaBurn Scorpion is a dynamic mobility exercise that enhances flexibility and range of motion. It engages multiple muscle groups while promoting core stability.
HowTo: 1. Start in a push-up position. 2. Lift your right leg and rotate your hip to bring your right foot towards your left hand. 3. Return to the starting position and repeat on the opposite side.

Title: MetaBurn Side Crawler
Desc: The MetaBurn Side Crawler is a full-body exercise that improves cardiovascular endurance and engages multiple muscle groups. It is great for building agility and coordination.
HowTo: 1. Start in a low squat position with your feet shoulder-width apart. 2. Move sideways by stepping with your right foot, followed by your left foot, keeping low to the ground. 3. Continue moving side to side for a set distance or duration.

Title: MetaBurn Side Plank Oblique Crunch
Desc: The Side Plank Oblique Crunch is an effective exercise for targeting the obliques and improving core stability. It combines a side plank with a crunch movement to engage the entire core.
HowTo: 1. Start in a side plank position with your elbow directly under your shoulder. 2. Engage your core and lift your hips. 3. Bring your top knee towards your chest while crunching your obliques. 4. Return to the starting position and repeat.

Title: MetaBurn Sit-Through
Desc: The Sit-Through is a dynamic movement that enhances core stability and mobility. It requires coordination and engages multiple muscle groups.
HowTo: 1. Start in a tabletop position on your hands and knees. 2. Lift one hand and the opposite foot off the ground, extending them out to the side. 3. Rotate your torso and bring your extended leg underneath your body, returning to the starting position. 4. Alternate sides.

Title: MetaBurn Sit-Up To V-Up
Desc: The Sit-Up To V-Up is a challenging core exercise that targets the abdominal muscles. It combines two movements to enhance strength and endurance.
HowTo: 1. Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. 2. Perform a sit-up to bring your torso up. 3. As you reach the top, extend your legs and lift your torso into a V-up position. 4. Lower back down and repeat.

Title: MetaBurn Sit-Up With Rotation
Desc: The Sit-Up With Rotation is an effective exercise for targeting the core, especially the obliques. It adds a rotational component to the traditional sit-up for increased engagement.
HowTo: 1. Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. 2. Perform a sit-up while rotating your torso to one side. 3. Return to the starting position and repeat, alternating sides.

Title: MetaBurn Split-Leg Crunch
Desc: The Split-Leg Crunch is a variation of the traditional crunch that targets the upper and lower abs. It helps to improve core strength and stability.
HowTo: 1. Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor, one leg straight and the other bent. 2. Perform a crunch by lifting your shoulders off the ground while keeping one leg extended. 3. Lower back down and repeat, then switch leg positions.

Title: MetaBurn Tabletop Hip Thrust
Desc: The MetaBurn Tabletop Hip Thrust is a variation of the hip thrust exercise that targets the glutes and hamstrings. It is performed from a tabletop position, engaging the core for stability.
HowTo: 1. Start in a tabletop position with your shoulders and knees on the ground. 2. Drive through your heels and lift your hips towards the ceiling, squeezing your glutes at the top. 3. Lower back down to the starting position and repeat.

Title: MetaBurn Tabletop With Russian Kick
Desc: The MetaBurn Tabletop With Russian Kick is an exercise that combines core stability with dynamic movement. It targets the obliques and rectus abdominis while also engaging the hip flexors.
HowTo: 1. Start in a tabletop position with your hands under your shoulders and knees under your hips. 2. Extend one leg out behind you while rotating your torso to the opposite side and kicking the other leg forward. 3. Return to the starting position and alternate sides.

Title: MetaBurn Toe Driver Abs
Desc: The MetaBurn Toe Driver Abs is an exercise designed to strengthen the abdominal muscles and improve core stability. It involves a driving motion that engages the hip flexors as well.
HowTo: 1. Lie on your back with your legs extended and arms at your sides. 2. Lift your legs towards the ceiling while simultaneously driving your toes towards your chest. 3. Lower back down slowly and repeat.

Title: MetaBurn-V-Up
Desc: The MetaBurn-V-Up is a challenging core exercise that targets the abdominal muscles. It combines a V-up motion with a focus on engaging the obliques.
HowTo: 1. Lie on your back with your arms extended overhead and legs straight. 2. Simultaneously lift your arms and legs off the ground, bringing them together in a V-shape. 3. Lower back down and repeat.

Title: X-body V-up
Desc: The X-body V-up is a bodyweight abdominal exercise performed on the floor. It is similar to the popular V-up exercise, but is performed with the arms and legs out wide in an X-shape. It primarily targets the muscles of the rectus abdominis, or six-pack muscles. It can be performed for reps or time, either as part of an ab-focused workout or as a component of a circuit workout.
HowTo: 1. Lie on your back with your arms and legs extended out wide in an X shape. 2. Simultaneously lift your arms and legs towards the center, forming a V shape. 3. Lower back down and repeat.

Title: MetaBurn Swivel Crunch
Desc: The MetaBurn Swivel Crunch is an exercise that targets the core muscles, particularly the abdominals. It involves a twisting motion to enhance core stability and flexibility.
HowTo: 1. Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. 2. Place your hands behind your head. 3. Lift your shoulders off the ground and twist your torso to one side, then return to the center and twist to the other side.

Title: Robertson Core-Engaged Dead Bug
Desc: The Robertson Core-Engaged Dead Bug is an effective core stabilization exercise. It helps improve coordination and core strength while engaging multiple muscle groups.
HowTo: 1. Lie on your back with your arms extended towards the ceiling and knees bent at 90 degrees. 2. Engage your core and lower one arm and the opposite leg towards the floor while keeping your back flat. 3. Return to the starting position and repeat on the other side.

Title: FYR2 Double-Under
Desc: The FYR2 Double-Under is a high-intensity jump rope exercise that improves cardiovascular endurance and coordination. It involves jumping higher and swinging the rope twice under your feet in one jump.
HowTo: 1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold the jump rope handles. 2. Start jumping and swing the rope under your feet twice before landing. 3. Repeat the process, maintaining a steady rhythm.

Title: FYR2 Fire Feet with Burpee Tuck Jump Drill
Desc: The FYR2 Fire Feet with Burpee Tuck Jump Drill combines agility and strength training. It enhances cardiovascular fitness while engaging multiple muscle groups.
HowTo: 1. Start in a standing position. 2. Quickly move your feet in and out while maintaining a low squat position. 3. After a set number of reps, jump into a burpee and perform a tuck jump.

Title: FYR2 Flutter Kick
Desc: The FYR2 Flutter Kick is a core exercise that targets the lower abdominal muscles. It helps improve core endurance and stability.
HowTo: 1. Lie on your back with your hands under your hips and legs extended. 2. Lift your legs slightly off the ground and alternate kicking them up and down in a flutter motion. 3. Keep your core engaged and lower back pressed into the floor.

Title: FYR2 Half-Moon
Desc: The FYR2 Half-Moon is a dynamic exercise that promotes flexibility and balance. It engages multiple muscle groups while enhancing core stability.
HowTo: 1. Start in a standing position. 2. Shift your weight onto one leg and extend the opposite leg out to the side. 3. Reach your arms overhead and lean towards the extended leg, maintaining balance. 4. Return to the starting position and repeat on the other side.

Title: FYR2 Leopard Crawl
Desc: The FYR2 Leopard Crawl is a low-impact exercise that builds strength and endurance while improving coordination. It mimics the movement of a crawling leopard, engaging the entire body.
HowTo: 1. Start on all fours with your hands under your shoulders and knees under your hips. 2. Lift your knees slightly off the ground. 3. Move your right hand and left foot forward simultaneously, followed by your left hand and right foot. 4. Continue crawling forward in a controlled manner.

Title: FYR2 Plank Alternating Front Step
Desc: The FYR2 Plank Alternating Front Step is an advanced core exercise that challenges stability and strength. It requires coordination and engages multiple muscle groups.
HowTo: 1. Begin in a plank position with your hands directly under your shoulders. 2. Step your right foot forward to the outside of your right hand. 3. Return your foot to the plank position and repeat with the left foot. 4. Continue alternating sides while maintaining a stable core.

Title: FYR2 Shoulder Tap
Desc: The FYR2 Shoulder Tap is an effective exercise for building shoulder stability and core strength. It challenges balance while engaging the upper body.
HowTo: 1. Start in a plank position with your hands under your shoulders. 2. Lift your right hand and tap your left shoulder while keeping your hips stable. 3. Return your right hand to the ground and repeat with your left hand tapping your right shoulder. 4. Continue alternating sides.

Title: Hand shift plank
Desc: The hand shift plank is a progression of the straight-arm plank exercise where you maintain a plank position as you shift your hands side to side. The additional movement forces the core muscles to work harder to stabilize.
HowTo: 1. Begin in a straight-arm plank position with your hands under your shoulders. 2. Shift your right hand to the right side while keeping your body straight. 3. Shift your left hand to follow, returning to the plank position. 4. Repeat the movement side to side for the desired duration.

Title: Cross-body plank march
Desc: The cross-body plank march is an exercise targeting the entire core but especially the obliques. Its more difficult than a standard plank, with the extra stabilization challenge of bringing one knee at a time off the ground toward the opposing elbow. This will increase the challenge to the core and shoulder muscles, but also present a coordination and balance challenge.
HowTo: Start in a plank position. Bring one knee towards the opposite elbow, then return to plank and alternate sides.

Title: Bent-knee Copenhagen hip adduction
Desc: The bent-knee Copenhagen hip adduction is an advanced exercise that combines the isometric stabilization of the Copenhagen plank with dynamic adductions to challenge the core stabilizers and adductors. This exercise targets the same muscles as the side plank, including the obliques, shoulders, and lateral hips, but places extra emphasis on the adductors and is more difficult than side planks on the floor. Most lifters will need to progress to this version after mastering the basic side plank or Copenhagen plank first.
HowTo: Begin in a Copenhagen plank position with one foot on a bench. Lower and lift the bottom leg while maintaining stability with the top leg.

Title: Copenhagen plank
Desc: The Copenhagen plank is an advanced version of the side plank performed with one foot on a bench and the other foot hovering under it. This exercise targets the same muscles as the side plank, including the obliques, shoulders, and lateral hips, but places extra emphasis on the adductors and is more difficult than side planks on the floor. Most lifters will need to progress to this version after mastering the basic side plank or feet-elevated side plank first.
HowTo: Start in a side plank position with one foot elevated on a bench. Hold the position while engaging the core and maintaining balance.

Title: ACFT Hanging leg tuck
Desc: The hanging leg tuck is an exercise targeting the entire body, including the arms, upper back, abs, and hip flexors. This specific exercise is part of the new Army Combat Fitness Test or ACFT. It is performe while hanging from a bar and combines elements of a pull-up with a leg raise. Experienced lifters make these look easy, but beginners may need time to build up to sets of 8-12 reps.
Muscles: arms, upper back, abs, hip flexors
HowTo: Hang from a bar with an overhand grip. Pull your knees towards your chest while keeping your core engaged.

Title: Alternating hanging knee raise
Desc: The alternating hanging knee raise is an exercise targeting the abs, but which also works the lats and hip flexors. Rather than performing both legs at a time, you lift one knee at a time and alternate with each rep as if marching in place. Knee raises are often performed for moderate to high reps, such as 8-12 reps or more, as part of ab-focused training.
HowTo: Hang from a bar with an overhand grip. Lift one knee towards your chest, alternating legs as if marching.

Title: Plank To Sphinx
Desc: The Plank to Sphinx is a dynamic exercise that transitions between a plank position and a sphinx pose. It helps improve core stability and flexibility.
HowTo: 1. Start in a forearm plank position. 2. Push up onto your hands, transitioning into a sphinx position. 3. Lower back down to the forearm plank and repeat.

Title: Twisting Mountain Climbers
Desc: Twisting Mountain Climbers are a high-intensity exercise that engages multiple muscle groups while improving cardiovascular endurance. This exercise also enhances core stability and coordination.
Muscles: Rectus Abdominis, Obliques, Hip Flexors, Shoulders
HowTo: 1. Start in a high plank position. 2. Drive one knee towards the opposite elbow while twisting your torso. 3. Switch legs quickly, alternating sides in a running motion.

Title: Jack Knives
Desc: Jack Knives are an effective exercise for targeting the abdominal muscles, particularly the rectus abdominis. This exercise also engages the hip flexors and improves overall core strength.
HowTo: 1. Lie on your back with your legs extended and arms overhead. 2. Simultaneously raise your legs and upper body, reaching your hands towards your feet. 3. Lower back down and repeat.

Title: Hanging Leg Raises
Desc: Hanging Leg Raises are a challenging exercise that targets the lower abdominal muscles. They also improve grip strength and overall core stability.
HowTo: 1. Hang from a pull-up bar with your arms fully extended. 2. Keeping your legs straight, raise them towards your chest. 3. Lower them back down slowly and repeat.

Title: Dumbbell suitcase crunch
Desc: The dumbbell suitcase crunch is a weighted version of a popular abdominal training exercise. The simple addition of a weight makes the suitcase crunch far more difficult, helping build the "six pack" muscles and providing a different stimulus to the core during training.
HowTo: 1. Lie on your back with your knees bent and hold a dumbbell in one hand. 2. Perform a crunch by lifting your shoulders off the ground while bringing the dumbbell towards your knees. 3. Lower back down and repeat, switching sides.

Title: Medicine ball rotational throw
Desc: The medicine ball rotational throw is an explosive exercise targeting the abdominals, including the obliques, as well as the hips and upper back. It involves standing sideways to the wall and twisting the torso to hurl a medicine ball into the wall, then catching the ball on the ricochet. It can be performed for lower reps with a focus on power, or for higher reps with a focus on fat loss and conditioning.
Muscles: obliques, rectus abdominis, hips, upper back
HowTo: 1. Stand sideways to a wall holding a medicine ball. 2. Twist your torso to throw the ball against the wall, then catch it on the rebound.

Title: Hollow-hold ball toss
Desc: The hollow-hold ball toss is a more difficult version of the hollow-body hold exercise. It involves tossing a ball to a partner while maintaining an isometric hold in the hollow-body position. It can be done for reps or time in any ab-focused workout, or in an "I go, you go" format.
HowTo: 1. Lie on your back in a hollow-body position. 2. Toss a ball to a partner while maintaining the hollow position.

Title: Partner front Russian twist and pass
Desc: The partner front Russian twist and pass is a weighted version of a popular abdominal training exercise that also utilizes a training partner to add another dynamic component. It targets the oblique muscles, as well as the deep muscles of the core and the rectus abdominis or "six pack" muscles. It can be done for reps or time in an ab-focused portion of any workout.
Muscles: obliques, rectus abdominis, deep core muscles
HowTo: 1. Sit facing your partner with a weighted object. 2. Perform a Russian twist to pass the weight to your partner, alternating sides.

Title: Sit-up with single-arm overhand throw
Desc: The sit-up with single-arm overhand throw is an exercise targeting the core muscles, but the inclusion of the throw also brings in other upper-body muscles. When you come to the top of the sit-up position, you throw a medicine ball using one arm to a partner who then throws it right back to you to be caught with both hands. It can be performed for time or reps as part of the ab-focused portion of any workout.
Muscles: rectus abdominis, obliques, upper body muscles
HowTo: 1. Lie on your back and perform a sit-up. 2. At the top, throw a medicine ball with one arm to a partner and catch it with both hands.

Title: Medicine ball partner twist
Desc: The medicine ball partner twist is a plyometrics exercise targeting the core muscles, particularly the obliques. You and a partner stand back to back and rotate in unison to pass a medicine ball back and forth on alternating sides.
HowTo: 1. Stand back to back with a partner holding a medicine ball. 2. Rotate your torso to pass the ball to your partner, alternating sides.

Title: Partner side Russian twist and pass
Desc: The partner side Russian twist and pass is a weighted version of a popular abdominal training exercise that also utilizes a training partner to add another dynamic component. It primarily targets the oblique muscles, as well as the deep muscles of the core and the rectus abdominis or "six pack" muscles. It can be done for reps or time in an ab-focused portion of any workout.
HowTo: 1. Sit on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat. 2. Hold a weighted medicine ball and twist your torso to one side, passing the ball to your partner. 3. Your partner will twist to the opposite side and pass the ball back to you. 4. Repeat for the desired number of reps or time.

Title: Medicine ball half moon
Desc: The medicine ball half moon is a dynamic core exercise performed around and over a medicine ball or other short, stationary object. It is similar in some ways to a V-up or reverse crunch, and targets both the obliques and the rectus abdominis or "six-pack" muscles. It can be performed for reps or for time, usually in dedicated ab training or as part of a medicine ball and bodyweight circuit workout.
HowTo: 1. Lie on your back with your legs extended and a medicine ball beside you. 2. Roll to the side, reaching for the ball, and then roll back to the starting position while engaging your core. 3. Repeat the movement, alternating sides.

Title: Exercise ball roll-out
Desc: The exercise ball roll-out is an exercise that strengthens the core, shoulders and upper- back muscles. It starts in a plank-style position, with the arms resting on a ball. Then, roll the ball out in front of you as far as you can while maintaining a strong, neutral spinal position. The lack of stability from the ball increases the degree of difficulty. This is a difficult movement, and beginners may need to use a limited range of motion.
HowTo: 1. Start in a plank position with your arms resting on an exercise ball. 2. Engage your core and roll the ball forward, extending your body while keeping a neutral spine. 3. Roll back to the starting position and repeat.

Title: Medicine ball pass
Desc: The medicine ball pass is a simple partner-based exercise that involves throwing a weighted ball back and forth. It can be part of a dynamic warm-up for lifting or athletics, but can also work as active rest or as a component of circuit training.
HowTo: 1. Stand facing your partner with a medicine ball. 2. Throw the ball to your partner and catch it as they throw it back. 3. Continue passing the ball back and forth for the desired duration.

Title: Partner medicine ball sit-up
Desc: The partner medicine ball sit-up is a more difficult version of the traditional abdominal exercise. Two partners pass a medicine ball back and forth at the top of each rep, so each one must alternate a weighted rep with an unweighted rep. This technique can be done for reps or time in any ab-focused workout, in an "I go, you go" format.
HowTo: 1. Lie on your back with your partner facing you, each holding a medicine ball. 2. Perform a sit-up and pass the ball to your partner at the top of the movement. 3. Your partner will then perform a sit-up and pass the ball back. 4. Alternate for the desired number of reps or time.

Title: Medicine ball Russian twist
Desc: The medicine ball Russian twist is a weighted version of a popular abdominal training exercise. It targets the oblique muscles, as well as the deep muscles of the core and the rectus abdominis or "six pack" muscles. It can be done for reps or time in the ab-focused portion of any workout.
HowTo: Sit on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat. Hold a medicine ball close to your chest, lean back slightly, and rotate your torso to one side, then to the other, while keeping your core engaged.

Title: 30 Medicine Ball Slam
Desc: The medicine ball slam is an explosive exercise for developing power, strength, and speed. Muscles worked include the abdominals, legs, triceps, shoulders, and lats. The slams are usually done in rapid succession to complete one set. It can also be a component of a power or athleticism-focused circuit workout.
HowTo: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a medicine ball overhead. Forcefully slam the ball to the ground in front of you, bending your knees and hinging at the hips, then catch it on the rebound and repeat.

Title: Medicine ball twist
Desc: The medicine ball twist is an exercise targeting the abdominal muscles, particularly the obliques. It is similar in many ways to a Russian twist exercise. The ball is held tight to the chest throughout the movement, and then the torso is rotated from side to side for the desired number of reps or a set amount of time.
HowTo: Sit on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat. Hold a medicine ball close to your chest, lean back slightly, and rotate your torso from side to side while keeping your core engaged.

Title: FYR2 Medicine Ball Complex
Desc: The FYR2 Medicine Ball Complex is a combination of exercises performed in sequence using a medicine ball. It typically includes movements that engage multiple muscle groups for a comprehensive workout.
HowTo: Start with a medicine ball in your hands. Perform a series of exercises such as squats, presses, and twists in a fluid motion, transitioning smoothly between each movement.

Title: FYR2 Medicine Ball Fire-Feet Drill
Desc: The FYR2 Medicine Ball Fire-Feet Drill is a high-intensity exercise that combines agility and coordination with the use of a medicine ball. It focuses on quick foot movements while maintaining control of the ball.
HowTo: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a medicine ball. Quickly alternate tapping your feet in place while keeping the ball at chest level, maintaining a fast pace to elevate your heart rate.

Title: FYR2 Medicine Ball Knees-to-Chest
Desc: The FYR2 Medicine Ball Knees-to-Chest is an exercise that targets the core muscles, particularly the rectus abdominis. It involves bringing the knees towards the chest while holding a medicine ball.
HowTo: 1. Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. 2. Hold a medicine ball above your chest. 3. Engage your core and lift your knees towards your chest while simultaneously bringing the medicine ball towards your knees. 4. Lower back down and repeat.

Title: FYR2 Medicine Ball Mountain Climber
Desc: The FYR2 Medicine Ball Mountain Climber is a dynamic exercise that engages multiple muscle groups while providing a cardiovascular workout. It involves alternating knee drives towards the chest in a plank position.
HowTo: 1. Start in a plank position with your hands under your shoulders and your body in a straight line. 2. Bring one knee towards your chest while keeping the other leg extended. 3. Quickly switch legs, bringing the opposite knee towards your chest. 4. Continue alternating legs at a fast pace.

Title: Decline oblique crunch
Desc: The decline oblique crunch is a popular bodyweight exercise targeting the obliques and the rectus abdominis or "six-pack" muscles. It is usually performed for high reps, such as 10-15 reps per set or more, as part of the ab-focused portion of a workout.
